name: spmregister
author: FreeSurfer Developers
description:
FreeSurfer is a software package for the analysis and visualization of neuroimaging data from cross-sectional and longitudinal studies. It is developed by the Laboratory for Computational Neuroimaging at the Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging.

FreeSurfer provides full processing streams for structural and functional MRI and includes tools for linear and nonlinear registration, cortical and subcortical segmentation, cortical surface reconstruction, statistical analysis of group morphometry, diffusion MRI, PET analysis, and much more. It is also the structural MRI analysis software of choice for the Human Connectome Project.

inputs.description: Id of the subject as found in SUBJECTS_DIR. This is converted to analyze using mri_convert.
inputs.name: Subject ID

inputs.description: Volume identifier of the movable volume. Must be specified in a way suitable for mri_convert.
inputs.name: Movable volume

inputs.description: Output registration file. Maps RAS in the reference to RAS in the movable.
inputs.name: Registration file

inputs.description: Use something other than the first frame. Specify the frame number you want.
inputs.name: Frame number

inputs.description: Use the middle frame of the mov volume as the template.
inputs.name: Middle frame flag

inputs.description: Save the mov template when template is something other than the first frame.
inputs.name: Template output

inputs.description: Force input geometry to be RAS.
inputs.name: Force RAS flag

inputs.description: Resample mov and save as outvol.
inputs.name: Output volume
